pullrequest.title: Added parsing of pose information to DOM

content.raw: No tool, just manual inspection :) . I usually declare what's being used in each file. If a string is used in a header and in the `.cc`, I add the `#include <string>` in both files. My logic is not to relay on transitive `include's`. That way, if something changes in the header file, for example a `string` member variable is removed. You can remove the `include ` from the header file and nothing will "break" in the `.cc`. In any case, I'm happy to use other convention if sounds more reasonable too.
content.html: No tool, just manual inspection :) . I usually declare what's being used in each file. If a string is used in a header and in the .cc, I add the #include <string> in both files. My logic is not to relay on transitive include's. That way, if something changes in the header file, for example a string member variable is removed. You can remove the include from the header file and nothing will "break" in the .cc. In any case, I'm happy to use other convention if sounds more reasonable too.
